message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a novel initialization strategy for adversarial attacks that improves the diversity and success rates of attacks. The paper focuses on evaluating the proposed method on image classification datasets such as MNIST, CIFAR-10, and ImageNet, which are typically studied in the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) communities. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of the proposed method against recently proposed defense models, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper proposes a new variant of the PGD attack, which is a popular optimization-based attack method in the adversarial attack literature, and evaluates its performance against robust models, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG and cs.CV, followed by cs.CR, cs.AI, and cs.NE.
